intro: Oryza sativa var. kissiensis, commonly known as the Kissi rice, is a rare and ancient variety of rice native to West Africa. It is characterized by its small, aromatic grains and is typically grown in swampy or wetland environments. The plant has a short growth cycle and is adapted to low-nutrient soils, making it resilient in challenging conditions. Its botanical features include a prostrate growth habit and a distinctive, fibrous root system. This variety is of interest to botanists and agricultural researchers due to its potential for genetic diversity and adaptation to climate change.
